text: Alain Corneau (7 August 1943 – 30 August 2010) was a French movie director and writer. Corneau was born in Meung-sur-Loire, Loiret. Originally a musician, he worked with Costa-Gavras as an assistant, which was also his first opportunity to work with the actor Yves Montand, with whom he would collaborate three times later in his career, including Police Python 357 (1976) and La Menace (1977). He directed Gérard Depardieu in the screen adaptation of Tous les matins du monde in 1991. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2010 deaths Category:French movie directors Category:People from Loiret
